file_content.text: The men all talk about how good it is to see those statues beaming down at us. I can't thank you enough.
You've shown the men that those Mandos can be beaten--I can't thank you enough.
Those Mandalorians won't be troubling you anymore.
I heard the cheers when the first statue came back. Figured you must have succeeded.
I saw a Comm report just before you arrived--our troops are pushing back hard, and really taking the fight to the Mandos.
We're already deeper than we've ever made it before. The Mandalorians are finally on the defensive, thanks to you.
All your men needed was some relief; glad I could do it.
I'm pleased to have helped.
You've given us all something to hope for--a Corellia that's free of the Empire's goons.
I did what I could.
You've lit a fire in their hearts--it's turned the battle around.
Thank you. If I can't be there with my squad, it's good to know they've got a chance
Your soldiers have it easy now that I took out the rocket troops.
I did the hard work for you
Yeah, because Mandalorian troops are so easy to push back. Thanks for the help, but we'll take it from here.
I know you're working hard out there, but another group of rocketeers attacked Squad Epsilon. We can't let any of them get away.
I can't tell you what it means to see you here, Major. You SpecForce guys are an inspiration to the rest of us.
I just wish I could help my squad--these Mandalorian rocket troops that the Empire brought in are tearing them apart.
You're hurt, Lieutenant, but I might be able to do something for them.
Can I help them, soldier?
I'm honored, sir. It's those rocket troops--my squad can't handle elites like them.
I wasn't expecting visitors. I'd get up, but the med-droids just yell at me if I try.
I guess I'm better off than Hawkins, but that's not saying much--the Empire's new Mandalorian rocket troops are tearing my squad apart.
Don't move. Just tell me how you ended up here.
What's your story, soldier?
Sir. We were supposed to take back the park when we ran into the Mandalorians.
The Mandalorians haven't used those before.
Rocket troops? That's new.
They're some kind of elite squad, they've got jump packs and rapid fire blasters that punch through armor.
You wouldn't have this problem if you grunts learned to get out of the line of fire.
Maybe you should duck.
It's tougher than it sounds when you're facing Mandalorian elites.
Those jump packs let them go anywhere they want, and they pick us off like womp rats on a junk heap.
Now I'm stuck in here, my men don't have support--don't suppose a Jedi could back them up?
We're regular soldiers, Major, but you--everyone says Mandos aren't a problem for Havoc Squad.
Us grunts have to stick together, Lieutenant. I'll get rid of those Mandos.
Anything for a fellow soldier.
I'd feel a lot better about being stuck here if I knew somebody took out those rocket troops--then my squad might have a chance.
I can't refuse a wounded man; I'll take care of your Mandalorians.
It'd be an honor to help you.
I can't thank you enough for this. The Mandos set up their camps along the Cross of Glory Walk. A slap in the face.
I'll take care of your Mandalorian problem. Where should I look?
Tell me where the enemy is.
They've got camps all along the Cross of Glory Walk, but they can attack anywhere.
There's something else--the Mandos turned off the holo-statues along the Walk when they put up artillery.
Taking out the Mandos saves lives, but Master Jedi--getting those statues back would restore our heroes. Send a message to the whole city.
Those statues show our heroes, Major. I told my boys, I'll tell you... restoring them would put the city's morale back on track.
Those statues show our most valiant heroes. You can imagine what seeing them restored would do for the city's morale.
People deserve their heroes. I'll see to the statues and the Mandalorians, rest assured.
I can restore the statues, too
Healing the people's morale is as important as removing the threat to their lives.
I can restore the statues, too
Say no more. I'll get rid of the Mandalorians and reactivate those statues.
I can restore the statues, too
Thank you. Sir!
It was pretty dull around here--restoring some statues and fighting a few Mandalorians should be fun.
I can restore the statues, too
Thank you --there's not enough folks like you in the galaxy.
I'll fix the statues if I can.
That's the best I can hope for, I guess--at least the rocket troops will be taken care of.
I'll take care of the Mandalorians, but I make no guarantee on the statues.
I can only get the Mandos.
The rocket troops are more important anyway. Once they're out of the way we should be able to do the rest.
According to the medics, I'll be waiting right here. If you have time to visit again... tell me how it goes.
Thanks, but no. [Refuse quest]
That makes sense, right? Leave us grunts to die while you get the fame? Thanks for nothing.
It's not fair--I should be out there leading my men, not stuck in an outpost playing spectator.
